intro: Narcissus rivas-martinezii, commonly known as the Rivas-Martinez daffodil, is a rare and endemic species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is a bulbous perennial that blooms in early spring, showcasing the typical features of the Amaryllidaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
